org.universAAL.middleware.container

Interface LogListener

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    LogListenerEx
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BusRecorder, LogListenerHandler.LocalLogListener, LogMonitor, LogMonitor, LogMonitor, LogMonitor, LogMonitor, LogMonitor, LogMonitor

    public interface LogListener
    Listener interface for new log entries. The log listeners are called automatically when adding a log entry to LogUtils. To use this method, create a class (e.g. LogMonitor) that implements this interface, and register the class as shared object, i.e.: 
     LogMonitor lm = new LogMonitor();
 myModuleContext.getContainer().shareObject(myModuleContext, lm,
     new Object[] { LogListener.class.getName() });
    To stop listening to log messages, the shared objects needs to be removed: 
     myModuleContext.getContainer().removeSharedObject(myModuleContext, lm,
     new Object[] { LogListener.class.getName() });
    Author:
    Carsten Stockloew

    • Method Detail

      • log

        void log(int logLevel,
         String module,
         String pkg,
         String cls,
         String method,
         Object[] msgPart,
         Throwable t)
        Log a new message.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - the log level (trace, debug, info, warn, or error)
        module - the name of the module that contains the class that intends to generate the log message
        pkg - the name of the package that contains the class that intends to generate the log message
        cls - the name of the class that intends to generate the log message
        method - The name of the method in the above Java class that intends to generate the log message
        msgPart - An array of strings and other objects that should be concatenated using String.valueOf(Object) in order to construct the log message
        t - An optional Throwable object like an exception that might have caused the log request
